channel.title: Computer crashed (Computer part or Windows part?)
channel.description:
Hello,
My computer crashed, when i was playing a server.
When i start my computer it says something like this:
"You are missing hal.dll"
I have googled it, but its a part of internet? I cant start my pc,
My question is:
Do i have to repair a part of my computer?
Or could i just re-install windows?
:)

item.title: Computer crashed (Computer part or Windows part?)
item.dc:creator: @wales_00 wales 00
item.description:
@wales_00 wrote:

Enter Windows XP Recovery Console.

When you reach the command line prompt (detailed in Step 6 in the link above), type the following and then press Enter:

expand d:\i386\hal.dl_ c:\windows\system32\hal.dll
Using the expand command as shown above, d represents the drive letter assigned to the optical drive that your Windows XP CD is currently in. While this is most often d, your system could assign a different letter. Also, c:\windows represents the drive and folder that Windows XP is currently installed on. Again, this is most often the case but your system could be different.

If you’re prompted to overwrite the file, press Y.

Take out the Windows XP CD, type exit and then press Enter to restart your PC.

Assuming that a missing or corrupt hal.dll file was your only issue, Windows XP should now start normally.

Read full topic
item.source: Computer crashed (Computer part or Windows part?)

item.title: Computer crashed (Computer part or Windows part?)
item.dc:creator: @Jordiescape Jordiescape
item.description:
@Jordiescape wrote:

[quote=“DPreborn, post:6, topic:312880”][quote author=Jordiescape link=topic=409297.msg3021106#msg3021106 date=1257603370]
Don’t re-install windows, just repair it.
[/quote]

Ye but he ask, like what part of the computer it is.

Dal.dll is something to do with internet

http://www.file.net/process/dal.dll.html (Information about dal.dll)[/quote]
He also asked what hal.dll is, not dal.dll.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer crashed (Computer part or Windows part?)
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Always make a backup disk

With my computer a pop up use to come up and say “Restore compter to its last working state”
If you get that but it doesnt show keep restarting your comp each time and usually there will be an option and the next time after you’ll get the option

Read full topic
